title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the treatment of unutilized limitation amounts and the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. The Secretary will allocate any unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation after December 31, 2020. This allocation will prioritize facilities placed in service before that date that did not receive a full allocation, followed by facilities placed in service after that date in chronological order. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation will be allocated after December 31, 2020. Priority will be given to facilities that did not receive a full allocation before that date, followed by facilities placed in service after that date in chronological order. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the total capacity allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, minus any allocation to facilities not in service by that date. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the total capacity allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, reduced by any allocation to facilities not in service by that date. This allocation is treated the same way as other provisions in this section. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary is treated the same as other provisions in this section. Coordination with other provisions ensures that subsection (d)(1)(B) does not apply to facilities receiving this allocation. The Secretary allocates national megawatt capacity limitation, exempting facilities receiving the allocation from subsection (d)(1)(B). Public entities can transfer credits under Section 45J of the Code. The amendment to Section 45J of the Code allows qualified public entities to transfer credits for a taxable year. The amendment to Section 45J of the Code allows qualified public entities to transfer credits for a taxable year. If a qualified public entity elects to transfer the credit to an eligible project partner, the partner will be treated as the taxpayer for that credit. Definitions for this subsection are provided. The amendment to Section 45J of the Code allows qualified public entities to transfer credits to eligible project partners, who will be treated as the taxpayer for that credit. The term 'qualified public entity' refers to Federal, State, or local government entities. The term 'qualified public entity' includes Federal, State, or local government entities, mutual or cooperative electric companies, and not-for-profit electric utilities that have received a loan. The term 'eligible project partner' refers to individuals involved in the design or construction of a project, including mutual or cooperative electric companies and not-for-profit electric utilities that have received a loan under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936. The term 'eligible project partner' includes individuals involved in designing or constructing an advanced nuclear power facility, as well as those providing the nuclear steam supply system for the facility. The credit under subsection (a) applies to individuals involved in providing the nuclear steam supply system and nuclear fuel to the advanced nuclear power facility. The credit under subsection (a) applies to individuals involved in providing nuclear fuel to the advanced nuclear power facility, including those with an ownership interest in the facility. Special rules apply for partnerships determining the credit at the partnership level. Special rules apply for partnerships determining the credit at the partnership level, where a qualified public entity is treated as the taxpayer with respect to their distributive share of the credit, and any partner of the partnership is considered an eligible project partner. The credit is taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner after the qualified public entity's taxable year. The credit is taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner after the qualified public entity's taxable year, without being considered as a private business use under section 141(b)(1). The credit is determined without being considered as a private business use under section 141(b)(1). Special rules apply for proceeds of transfers for mutual or cooperative electric companies. Special rule for proceeds of transfers for mutual or cooperative electric companies: Income received in connection with an election under section 45J(e)(1) will be treated as collected from members to cover losses and expenses. Income received in connection with an election under section 45J(e)(1) will be treated as collected from members for the purpose of meeting losses and expenses. The effective dates for the amendments are the date of enactment for unutilized limitation amounts and taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016 for transfer of credit by certain public entities. The amendment for unutilized limitation amounts takes effect on the enactment date, while the transfer of credit by certain public entities applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
